TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract beforefieldinit KeyInfoClause extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Represents the abstract base class from which all implementations of subelements inherit.

remarks.format:
## Remarks You can use KeyInfoClause objects to build a <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.KeyInfo> object for a specific digital signature or encrypted XML document. <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.KeyInfo> allows recipients of XML digital signatures and encrypted XML documents to determine which signing method and key values should be used for validation and decryption.
For more information about the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.KeyInfo> element and its subelements, see the XMLDSIG specification, which is available from the W3C at www.w3.org/TR/xmldsig-core/, or see the XML encryption specification, which is available from the W3C at www.w3.org/TR/xmlenc-core/.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

remarks.format: ## Remarks You cannot create an instance of an abstract class. Application code creates a new instance of a derived class.

Docs.summary: When overridden in a derived class, returns an XML representation of the .

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Xml.XmlElement> returned by this method is suitable for use as a subelement of an XMLDSIG or encrypted XML `<KeyInfo>` element.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This method is typically used to process a subelement of a `<KeyInfo>` element.
